word_forms.definition_en: to consider something and try to decide what is true, what will happen, what one should do, and so on

examples.example: Samuel wonders if he will lose some weight after he joins the swimming club.
examples.translate: Samuel想知道他加入游泳社之後，是否就能減重。

examples.example: Kelly always wonders about the things she recalls from her dreams and what they mean.
examples.translate: Kelly老是想知道她憶起的夢境及它們的意義。

word_forms.definition_en: very surprising, incredible, and hard to believe

examples.example: It’s amazing how bright the stars are outside of the city at night!
examples.translate: 城市外夜晚的星星如此明亮，令人大感驚奇！

word_forms.definition_en: an amount, type, or level that is in the middle

examples.example: Helen usually scores above average on her exams because she always studies much harder than her classmates.
examples.translate: Helen的考試成績通常高於平均，因為她總是比同學更加用功。

examples.example: As a police officer, Amy makes a little more money than the national average.
examples.translate: Amy擔任警官，她的薪水比全國平均高一些。

examples.example: The runners finished the race in an average of two minutes and ten seconds.
examples.translate: 跑者們以兩分十秒的平均時間完成比賽。

examples.example: Even though the price of some new smartphones is high, the average price continues to drop every year.
examples.translate: 即使有些新款智慧型手機的價錢高，但平均價格仍逐年下降。

examples.example: The average teenager would rather send a LINE message than write a letter to a friend.
examples.translate: 一般青少年寧願傳LINE訊息給朋友，也不寫信。

word_forms.definition_en: as a result of something that was just mentioned

examples.example: The boots were much more expensive than Tina had expected; therefore, she didn’t buy them.
examples.translate: 這雙靴子比Tina預期貴上許多，因此，她就沒買了。

word_forms.definition_en: to sleep for a short period of time during the day

examples.example: Craig has a bad habit of staying up late and then napping several times during the day.
examples.translate: Craig有個壞習慣，常熬夜到很晚然後白天得小睡好幾次。

word_forms.definition_en: to remain on or near the surface of the water or of another liquid and not sink

examples.example: Jenna threw a piece of bread into the pond and watched it float until a fish ate it.
examples.translate: Jenna丟了一小片麵包到池塘裡，看著它漂在水面直到被魚吃掉。

examples.example: The couple lay on the grass and enjoyed the view of the clouds as they floated across the sky.
examples.translate: 這對夫婦躺在草地上，欣賞雲朵飄過天空的景色。

word_forms.definition_en: to prevent something, usually bad, from happening

examples.example: The family avoided getting stuck in the traffic jam by leaving home very early in the morning.
examples.translate: 這家人早上很早就出門，以免塞在車陣中。

word_forms.definition_en: the top layer of water or land, or the outer layer of something

examples.example: When too many people boarded the little boat, it began to sink below the surface of the water.
examples.translate: 太多人上了那艘小船，導致船身開始沉到水面下。

word_forms.definition_en: to take air into your lungs and blow it out through your nose or mouth

examples.example: The yoga teacher told her students to breathe in as they lifted their arms above their heads.
examples.translate: 瑜珈老師要學員們將手臂高舉過頭的同時一邊吸氣。

examples.example: It’s so nice to go mountain climbing and breathe the fresh air.
examples.translate: 能爬山並呼吸新鮮空氣真的很棒。

word_forms.definition_en: not sleeping, no longer sleeping, or not yet asleep

examples.example: The loud music from the neighbors’ party kept the whole family awake all night.
examples.translate: 鄰居開派對的音樂聲太吵，讓這家人整夜睡不著。

word_forms.definition_en: able to make one feel amazed because something or someone is very good, skillful, etc.

examples.example: It’s so impressive that Brian can say “hello” and “thank you” in more than fifteen languages!
examples.translate: Brian能用超過十五種語言說「哈囉」和「謝謝你」，十分令人印象深刻。

word_forms.definition_en: the length of the space between two places or things

examples.example: The distance between the eastern end of Russia and the western one is about ten thousand kilometers.
examples.translate: 俄羅斯東西兩端的距離大約是一萬公里。

examples.example: In large cities in Taiwan, it is common to find more than one restaurant within walking distance of one’s home.
examples.translate: 臺灣的大城市裡常常可以在住家步行可及的距離內找到一家以上的餐廳。

word_forms.definition_en: a trip that is usually long in terms of distance or time

examples.example: After high school, the two best friends plan to go on a journey around the world.
examples.translate: 高中畢業後，這兩位最好的朋友計劃要去環遊世界。

word_forms.definition_en: the condition, state, or process of flying

examples.example: Baby birds usually take flight for the first time after they are only about two or three weeks old.
examples.translate: 幼鳥通常在約只有兩三週大時首次飛行。

examples.example: When Mrs. Kuo arrived at the airport, she learned that her flight was going to be thirty minutes late.
examples.translate: 當郭女士抵達機場時，得知她的航班將延誤三十分鐘。

word_forms.definition_en: several different types of something

examples.example: That store sells a wide variety of children’s toys and books.
examples.translate: 這間店販售各式各樣的童玩與童書。

word_forms.definition_en: a living thing such as an animal, or an imagined being such as a monster

examples.example: Nick is kind-hearted. He wouldn’t hurt any living creature, not even a mosquito.
examples.translate: Nick心地善良，他不會傷害任何生物，連一隻蚊子都不會。

word_forms.definition_en: a person with advanced knowledge, skills, or training in a particular field or subject

examples.example: Mr. Yang is an expert in math. I’m glad to have him as my tutor.
examples.translate: 楊老師是一位數學高手，我很高興有他當我的家教。

word_forms.definition_en: to stay alive or continue to exist

examples.example: Some animals are able to survive from season to season by changing the color of their fur.
examples.translate: 有些動物能靠著改變毛色，安然度過不同季節。

examples.example: Fortunately, all 103 passengers survived the plane crash.
examples.translate: 所幸機上103名旅客都倖免於這場墜機事件。

examples.example: The news report said that the missing mountain climbers had a low chance of survival.
examples.translate: 這篇新聞報導說，失蹤的登山客生存機率渺茫。

word_forms.definition_en: to grab hold of something

examples.example: It is a good idea to hold on to one of the poles while you are standing on a moving bus.
examples.translate: 當你站在行進中的公車上時，抓緊車上其中一根扶桿是個好主意。

word_forms.definition_en: to be aware that something exists and that you may see or run into it

examples.example: Make sure to look out for bees when you go hiking in the forest.
examples.translate: 當你在森林裡健行時，一定要小心蜜蜂出沒。

word_forms.definition_en: to watch carefully for something so you can stay out of danger

examples.example: Be on the lookout for falling rocks when you drive through the mountains after a rainstorm.
examples.translate: 暴風雨過後，在山區開車要小心落石。

word_forms.definition_en: used to demonstrate or provide an instance of something that was just said

examples.example: Katie has a really good memory. For example, she can memorize a short passage after she reads it once.
examples.translate: Katie記憶力很好。舉例來說，她可以把一篇短文讀過一遍後就背起來。

word_forms.definition_en: as stated by someone or something

examples.example: According to this news report, the whole village was ruined by the earthquake.
examples.translate: 根據這篇新聞報導，這整個村莊都被這場地震摧毀了。

word_forms.definition_en: as many or as much as

examples.example: Amazingly, some swimmers can hold their breath for up to twenty minutes.
examples.translate: 令人驚奇的是，有些泳者可以憋氣長達二十分鐘。
